newsitem.title: DENMARK: Rieber says has over 50 pct in Phoenix.
newsitem.headline: Rieber says has over 50 pct in Phoenix.

text.p: Norway's Rieber and Son said on Thursday that it now had over 50 percent of equity and votes in Danish roadbuilder Phoenix Contractors, a level at which it said earlier it would implement a takeover of the company.
Rieber director Olav Daviknes confirmed that the 50 percent level was reached after his firm bought the Phoenix holdings of Danish pension funds ATP and LD.
He was not immediately able to give the precise number of shares bought.
Phoenix earlier said it had increased its stake to 35.9 percent of Phoenix equity and said it would implement a takeover if it could build a stake above 50 percent.
A February 28 analysis showed ATP holding 10.4 percent of Phoenix equity and LD owning 3.0 percent.
Codan Insurance later said it had sold Rieber its 11.4 percent of equity.
If the Feburary 28 figures still hold, Rieber, would have at least 60.7 percent.
Rival bidder Icopal said it was likely to give up the fight and sell Rieber its stake, last recorded as 11.23 percent. --Steve Weizman, Copenhagen newsroom +45 33969650
